security: Revealing that Sturgis, with past CIA contact, called the FBI to pass on information, and that the FBI then contacted the source, reveals intelligence gathering methods and relationships with informants.  'Called John Minty, at FBI & gave him above imfort at 1:50 PM...Mr. Nasce of FBI called backs at 2:17 PM, asked if Ok w/ me if they have their Miami Ofe Contact St.'
summary: A handwritten note documenting a telephone call with Frank Sturgis on April 22, 1975, regarding information about Miami people, including possible CIA contacts, planning activities related to Henry Kissinger's trip to Venezuela.
summary_one_paragraph: This document is a handwritten note dated April 22, 1975, detailing a phone conversation with Frank Sturgis where he provides information regarding individuals in Miami, some with potential CIA connections, who are purportedly planning activities related to Henry Kissinger's upcoming trip to Venezuela; Sturgis mentions potential involvement of Dr. de Cardenas and the Satin Cem-Anti Comin. League. Sturgis relayed information about Park Woolen who was a C/A agent in Santiago de Cuba. Sturgis reported that Jock Stewart and Jom Knowles were in Havana. Sturgis contacted the FBI with this information, and the FBI followed up with Sturgis to confirm whether they could contact him in Miami.
title: Handwritten Notes: Telephone Call with Sturgis on 4-22-75
sender: HPSCI (House Permanent Select Committee on Intelligence?) - implied
